page.title: 18 The Changing Village
page.content:
In the 70's and 80's there has been a change in the life style of the village and both Great Haseley and Milton Common have been affected. The building of the M40 brought about significant changes and introduced a new commuter type of villager attracted by the pleasant cottages and quiet environment of Great Haseley.Many of the farmworkers cottages were sold off as the farms became less labour intensive with the introduction of large farm machinery.At the same time many local authority houses were sold to tenants and the average age of the village became significantly higher.In particular the child population shrank and the school numbers dropped from over 100 to 40.
